result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Schram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 5 days jail, to be paid FORTHWITH. TIME SERVED.  Costs are deemed paid in full.

Straight Time.
Apply 32 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Schram

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian D Schram in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.


Court orders the following:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
32 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of Payment - Defendant to serve an additional 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Time Served.
Atty. Adam Schleis has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to have no contact with Subway or employees of Subway listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Brian D Schram in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
